summary: This is an email exchange from December 2008 between Jay Lefkowitz and an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding a meeting about Jeffrey Epstein. Lefkowitz declines to attend a meeting scheduled for Thursday with someone named Roy.

persons.name: Jay Lefkowitz
persons.context: Email sender who declines to attend a meeting about Jeffrey Epstein with Roy.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the planned meeting discussed in the email.

persons.name: Roy
persons.context: Person with whom a meeting about Jeffrey Epstein is scheduled for Thursday.

connections.description: Lefkowitz is involved in correspondence about a meeting regarding Epstein, suggesting a legal or advisory connection.

events.title: Planned meeting about Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: A meeting was scheduled for Thursday (likely December 4, 2008) involving Roy and potentially others to discuss Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: An email from December 2008 shows planning for a meeting about Jeffrey Epstein.
Attorney Jay Lefkowitz declines to attend the meeting with someone named Roy.
The email originates from or involves the law firm Kirkland & Ellis LLP, indicating legal representation or consultation in the Epstein case.
The correspondence is marked as confidential and potentially attorney-client privileged.
